ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Class got off to a rocky start but Ken was excellent and made up for shortcomings of the class. HWs were applied and practical and clearly explained.

This course was fantastic for those who had extensive background in genetics and desire to learn about the tools used in the analysis of genes. It is not practical for those that do not intend to use or interact with the tools used in the field of genetics. The course was interesting and informative. The availability of the teaching fellow was essential for the cultivation of an depth understanding of discussed course material beyond the presented information.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Hongyu Zhao  Dr. Zhao and Dr. Kidd both know the material incredibly well, but this class suffers from disorganization. Would be better taught by one or the other.

Instructor: Hongyu Zhao  The instructor was very knowledgeable in all areas discussed in the course. He did a wonderful job of making the course accessible to people with limited background in genetics and statistics.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Ken was exceptional, course would have been a disaster without him

Ken Hui was absolutely essential for my success in class because of his ability to provide necessary background data and his ability to simplify the information in ways that were accessible to me with my limited experience in dealing with tools used in genetics. The time and effort he spent enriching the information provided in lectures during the TA sections was very much appreciated.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Class is not that bad, just make sure a good TA is involved. If it's Ken Hui, absolutely take this class.

If my fellow student wants to learn about a variety of statistical tests used in the analysis of data produced by those in genetics then I would recommend this course. If my fellow student is not then I would not recommend it.
